item.name: Charm of Falsehood
item.text:
This item can be any small handmade object, though often it is carved from wood in simple styles. It can spontaneously appear in a community affected by a pseudo hydra. While attuned to it, you have proficiency in the Deception skill if you did not already, and you gain 1d8 temporary hit points any time you make an ability check that uses your Deception proficiency.
Source: GM Toolkit - Cryptids (Third Party)

item.name: Night Shard
item.text:
This ebony shard of smoky quartz is thin and delicate looking. A swirling vortex of black energy churns slowly inside the crystal. While attuned to it, you have resistance to psychic damage. The shard has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges to cast Black Tentacles (spell save DC 15) from it. The shard regains 1d6+1 expended charges daily at sunset. If you expend the shard's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the shard crumbles into ash and is destroyed.
Source: GM Toolkit - Cryptids (Third Party)

item.name: Amulet of the Forest Guardian
item.text:
Sasquatches and other creatures who designate themselves as guardians of the woodlands often create these items to bestow upon friendly allies in surrounding communities. An amulet of the frost guardians is carved from wood, usually from a fallen branch of the oldest tree in a forest, and enchanted to empower the wearer to serve the needs of the forest. While attuned to this item, you gain the following features:
• Your wisdom increases by 2, to a maximum of 20
• You can cast the following spells: 3/day each: Animal Friendship, Animal Messenger, Goodberry
• You can cast the following spells 1/day each: Greater Restoration, Speak with Plants, Tree Stride
Source: GM Toolkit - Cryptids (Third Party)

item.name: Cryptid Codex
item.text:
This weighty tome contains a wealth of knowledge and information about mysterious monsters from across the realms. Multiple copies are known to exist, each containing monstrous secrets, folkloric tales of cryptid encounters, and mad writings.
Attunement. Studying the cryptid codex requires 8 hours of uninterrupted concentration, which creates the attunement with the item. Once attuned, you have insights into the workings of strange monsters and cryptids.
Reveal Aspect. When encountering a creature of a challenge rating equal to or less than you level, you can use the action to make a DC 15 Intelligence check. On a success, you learn one aspect of the target creature from the following list: Armor Class, Hit Dice, Vulnerabilities, Resistances, Saving Throws, or Immunities.
Uncover Secret. You can use the cryptid codex as a reference for studying monsters to learn their secrets. During a short rest, you can choose a creature to study and make a DC 15 Intelligence check. On a success, you learn a legend, story or tale about the creature which relates to its abilities. The exact nature of the secret is left up to the GM.
Monster Command. While you are attuned to the cryptid codex and holding it, you can cast the following spells once per day each (saving throw DC 20) Dominate Monster and Hold Monster.
Source: GM Toolkit - Cryptids (Third Party)
